text:
If you insert a link to a resource document, the URL extension is ".html"
instead of the native extension of the resource.
creator: andreas@apache.org

text:
I have gotten around this by making the live view of a resource be the resource
itself instead of the resource page
creator: dhc4z@virginia.edu

text:
Should we make this the default setting? Since I dipped my feet into Ruby on
Rails, conventions seem somewhat appealing :)

OTOH, I don't mind to introduce a link resolving mechanism which considers the
inherent extension of resources.

What do the others think?
creator: andreas@apache.org

text:
If the source extension is not "xml", the source extension is now used as link
extension.
creator: andreas@apache.org
